intro: Collomia, commonly known as the fairy bells, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Boraginaceae. These plants are native to western North America, particularly found in mountainous regions of the United States and Canada. They are often found in open habitats such as meadows and woodlands, where they contribute to the floral diversity of their ecosystems.
